Yes, ensuring your website remains accessible as new technologies and devices become available is an ongoing process. Here are some tips:

1. Stay up-to-date with web accessibility guidelines: Keep yourself informed of the latest web accessibility guidelines by subscribing to mailing lists, following accessibility experts online, and attending conferences or webinars. 2. Test on new devices and technologies: Test your website on new devices and technologies as they become available to ensure that it remains accessible across all platforms and devices. 3. Conduct regular accessibility audits: Regularly conduct accessibility audits to ensure that your website is still accessible and to identify any areas that may have been overlooked. 4. Involve users with disabilities: Involve users with disabilities in your testing and user experience research to gain insights on how to improve your website's accessibility. 5. Train your development team: Ensure that your development team is trained in web accessibility best practices and make accessibility a part of your company's culture. By following these tips, you can ensure that your website is designed to be accessible, and stays accessible to all users, regardless of the device or technology they are using. Remember, web accessibility is an ongoing process, and it's important to continuously evaluate and improve your website's accessibility over time.
